At the start of the eclipse, there should be some good clear skies in Mexico, but into Texas, Austin and Dallas are looking quite cloudy with an increasing threat of some severe weather.

For eastern areas of Texas, severe storms, including tornadoes, may actually impact travel here after the spectacle.
